messages: db4527b32e976e105e549db55c39a21b (06:25): probably a bad time to ask this
db4527b32e976e105e549db55c39a21b (06:26): but on which threads can I call socket::isAlive?
942f66399dbed7df5031f8453b9b94da (06:28): funny you should ask...
942f66399dbed7df5031f8453b9b94da (06:28): db4527b32e976e105e549db55c39a21b, is it an SSL socket?
db4527b32e976e105e549db55c39a21b (06:28): let me rephrase
db4527b32e976e105e549db55c39a21b (06:29): I've got a socket connection (may be SSL, may not be) which delivers to the main thread
db4527b32e976e105e549db55c39a21b (06:29): is it safe to try on the main thread?
942f66399dbed7df5031f8453b9b94da (06:29): on the one hand, there's http://mxr.mozilla.org/mozilla-central/source/netwerk/base/public/nsISocketTransport.idl#51
db4527b32e976e105e549db55c39a21b (06:29): I've been looking at the bugs
942f66399dbed7df5031f8453b9b94da (06:29): on the other hand, that's broken for non-sockettransport thread, AIUI
db4527b32e976e105e549db55c39a21b (06:29): it says it's safe to run on the "socket thread"
db4527b32e976e105e549db55c39a21b (06:30): I think bienvenu fixed it for IMAP by moving the call to the IMAP thread
942f66399dbed7df5031f8453b9b94da (06:30): it's kinda messy right now because of recent changes
942f66399dbed7df5031f8453b9b94da (06:31): the intention is/used to be that you can call it anywhere
db4527b32e976e105e549db55c39a21b (06:31): that's why I'm asking and not merely assuming that the IDL is correct
942f66399dbed7df5031f8453b9b94da (06:31): I think we should try to make impl match the IDL
942f66399dbed7df5031f8453b9b94da (06:31): but it sounded like other people don't necessarily agree

db4527b32e976e105e549db55c39a21b (06:32): (actually, I knew that it was problematic before and only stumbled on the fact that the IDL claims to be threadsafe last night when I was trying to find the interface that went ERK, MAIN THREAD ONLY)
db4527b32e976e105e549db55c39a21b (06:32): (that latter interface is nsIChannel for future reference)
8684147451a6cc3b92142c6f4b78e61c (06:32): 042dd99eb0ff8653814e445ca0093427, anything else you suggest i point at it the next time it happens?  (to me it looks like it's hanging while crashing)
942f66399dbed7df5031f8453b9b94da (06:32): channels are indeed mainthread only
942f66399dbed7df5031f8453b9b94da (06:32): db4527b32e976e105e549db55c39a21b, I think the upshot is, talk to jduell tomorrow
db4527b32e976e105e549db55c39a21b (06:33): I posted it in the bug I was about to work on
042dd99eb0ff8653814e445ca0093427 (06:33): 8684147451a6cc3b92142c6f4b78e61c: yes, in your pastebin thread 28 looks guilty
db4527b32e976e105e549db55c39a21b (06:33): hopefully I can ping bienvenu tomorrow and go from there
042dd99eb0ff8653814e445ca0093427 (06:34): so you should file a bug on the JS engine and mention that
db4527b32e976e105e549db55c39a21b (06:34): mozilla::mailnews::mime, maybe I ought to go with mozilla::mime instead :-)

ac495561e6015364214b354ab23f7d2d (06:47): hi.. if given https://tbpl.mozilla.org/?tree=Try&rev=f6e9e43435b6,  I'm looking at |Rev3 Fedora 12 try debug test mochitests-1/5|,  it's giving me an 'undefined' error  and I have no clue what this means
ac495561e6015364214b354ab23f7d2d (06:49): how do I know if it's related to my patch?
a3f19f90edf0a0893c7847d08016abe3 (06:50): ac495561e6015364214b354ab23f7d2d, you have a look at the actual test
a3f19f90edf0a0893c7847d08016abe3 (06:50): ac495561e6015364214b354ab23f7d2d, the author of the test just didn't put any informative string in for their ok() calls
a3f19f90edf0a0893c7847d08016abe3 (06:52): ac495561e6015364214b354ab23f7d2d, the test has to do with JS object wrappers on XHR objects
ac495561e6015364214b354ab23f7d2d (06:56): hrm.. it does sound like something is screwy with my patch.. :(
8684147451a6cc3b92142c6f4b78e61c (07:07): starts adding a lot of custom fields, sorry
ac495561e6015364214b354ab23f7d2d (07:08): it goes to say.. just because it builds/compiles, it doesn't mean it works...
